content.title: Solar Power Subsidy Scheme
content.details: Launched in 2018, the 'Solar Power Subsidy Scheme' is one of the 'Information Technology Policy Schemes' by the Department of Information Technology, Government of Goa. The objective and the scope of this scheme is to provide Solar Power Subsidy to the eligible Information Technology Units in the State of Goa. All the New and Existing Units having their operations in Goa are eligible. The scheme has been framed as a part of Goa's IT Policy that envisages Goa as an aspirational geographical and human resource base for IT Units and a preferred destination for their investment and expansion.
benefits: Reimbursement of 10% of capital cost of installation of Solar Power Generation Unit, subject to a maximum subsidy of ₹50,00,000.
eligibility: All the new and existing units must have their operations in Goa.
The applicant must be one of the below: Proprietorship Firm, Private Limited Company, Public Limited Company, Registered Partnership Firm, Limited Liability Partnership.
The unit should be registered with Goa Energy Development Agency (GEDA) for production of solar power.
The bank accounts of the unit and/or its partner(s)/director(s) should be linked to Aadhaar.
exclusions: Units availing benefits under the Power Subsidy of the Policy are not eligible for availing benefits under this scheme.
content.application_process: Online. Visit the Official Web Portal of Goa Online, register, and follow the steps to apply.
documents_required: Copy of new unit registration document/certificate.
Copies of PAN, Aadhaar and GST TIN.
Copy of first bill generated showing the date of commencement of operations or other relevant document.
Copy of sanction letter of rebate from Central Government and proof of payment of the same, if available.
Copy of sanction letter of rebate from Goa State Government and proof of payment of the same, if available.
Contracts, purchase order or other relevant supporting document as proof of set up solar power generation unit.
Receipts or other proof of payment for items listed above, if applicable.

faqs.question: When does the scheme come into force, and for how long does it remain in force?
faqs.answer: The scheme comes into force from the date of its publication in the official Gazette and remains in force for five years from that date.

faqs.question: What policy does the Solar Power Subsidy Scheme align with?
faqs.answer: The scheme aligns with the Goa Information Technology Policy and Roadmap – 2018.

faqs.question: What does the policy envisage for Goa in terms of IT units?
faqs.answer: The policy envisions Goa as an aspirational geographical and human resource base for IT units and a preferred destination for their investment and expansion.

faqs.question: What is the primary objective of the Solar Power Subsidy Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective is to provide solar power subsidy to eligible Information Technology Units in the State of Goa.

faqs.question: Which types of business entities are eligible to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Proprietorship Firm, Private Limited Company, Public Limited Company, Registered Partnership Firm, Limited Liability Partnership.

faqs.question: What is a mandatory requirement for the unit to be eligible?
faqs.answer: The unit should be registered with Goa Energy Development Agency (GEDA) for the production of solar power.

faqs.question: Who is not eligible for benefits under the Solar Power Subsidy Scheme?
faqs.answer: Units availing benefits under the Power Subsidy of the Policy are not eligible.

faqs.question: What percentage of capital cost is eligible for reimbursement for units running on 100% solar energy?
faqs.answer: 10% of the capital cost, subject to a maximum subsidy of ₹50,00,000.

faqs.question: Are the benefits guaranteed throughout the policy period?
faqs.answer: No, benefits are subject to budgetary allocation, and no Promissory Estoppel applies if allocation is exceeded.

faqs.question: How often can an applicant apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant can apply quarterly/bi-annually/annually after incurring relevant expenditure.
